name: Sweet and Sour Asparagus
author: Barbara Kahian
summary: This is great at a picnic when you have tired of all the same old salads.  Very versatile, you can serve it cold or room temperature. You can certainly chop up the asparagus, but I found that it always overcooks.  I like the presentation of the long spears on a nice white platter. This goes great with a platter of sliced baked ham and some potato salad or with hamburgers and hot dogs.  Enjoy!
directions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil
Add the asparagus, and cook uncovered until slightly tender, about 1 minute
Drain in a colander, then immediately immerse in ice water for several minutes until cold to stop the cooking process
Once the asparagus spears are cold, place them on paper towels to dry
Bring vinegar, water, sugar, cinnamon sticks, cloves, celery seed, and salt to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat
Spread the asparagus spears in a large dish or baking pan
Pour the vinegar mixture over the asparagus
Cover and refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight
Drain and serve cold or at room temperature
